column4: I am having trouble compiling a kernel module - I keep getting GCC errors
like thus: gcc-3.4: command not found
ok - I'll try that again..thanks
hrmmm apt-get install sez - gcc is already the newest version.
lemme try synaptic
ah now I get Package gcc-3.4 is not available, but is referred to by another package.
This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
is only available from another source
do I need to update my apt-get repositories?
thanks...reading
paste your /etc/apt/sources.list file to pastebin please so we can figure out what is wrong '
I've posted my sources - see anything missing? http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8669
yep
put a # infront of the very first line the cdrom repo  than take the # away from the onther lines that start with deb
ok will do
ok this look good? http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8670
ok save that than sudo apt-get update
done
sudo apt-get install gcc-3.4 :)
if you were needing that
that did it - the kernel module compiled. Thank you!
